title: Adele, Kris Jenner and more arrive ahead of Jennifer Lawrence wedding
text:
Jennifer’s celebrity guests have started to arrive ahead of her wedding (Picture: Getty, Backgrid, Mega)

Jennifer Lawrence is set to tie the knot to Cooke Maroney today (Saturday 19 October) and her celebrity guests have arrived in Rhode Island ahead of the big event.

JLaw and Cooke may have only got engaged eight months ago – and you know how quickly celebs’ diaries fill up – but they managed to secure an extremely A-list guest list for their nuptials.

The couple hosted a pre-wedding clam bake for their friends and family, and stars including Adele, Cameron Diaz, Nicole Richie and Joel Madden all arrived to celebrate with them.

Kardashian matriarch and momager Kris Jenner was also seen arriving in an extravagant black coat – she wasn’t taking any chances of catching a chill as she boarded a boat to take her to the restaurant.

Jennifer and Cooke flew in on a private jet from New York, and were seen hopping into an SUV to take them on to their destination.

Cooke had asked Jennifer to marry him in February, and we have to say we are impressed that the couple managed to turn around planning a wedding in such a tight timescale despite their busy schedules.

Kris Jenner wrapped up warm as she headed to the boat (Picture: BACKGRID)

Adele tried to keep a low profile as she and Nicole Richie arrived (Picture: BACKGRID)

The gang were ferried to the rehearsal dinner on a boat (Picture: MEGA)

Details of the food and drink the couple are going to be serving their guests was also revealed earlier in the week – and we hope they all have sophisticated palates…

Guests will be treated to specialty cocktails including bourbon old fashioneds and gin cucumber lavender champagnes.

Their starters will be cod beignet, sweet potato flat cakes, brussels sprouts with cured egg yolk and smoked pork belly with pickled apple.

Main courses are wood-roasted fish with herbs and lemon-infused butter or five-week-aged leg of beef with foragers sauce, and for dessert it’s fire-baked sourdough bread pudding with chocolate, salted caramel and fresh apple, cauldron fritters with bourbon cream and cinnamon sugar and homemade s’mores.
